intro: Ocimum mitwabense, commonly known as the Ethiopian basil, is a species of flowering plant in the Lamiaceae family. It is native to Ethiopia and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice in local cuisines. Ocimum mitwabense is also valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological benefits in its native habitat.
